thread.title: Brother of Toowoomba murder victim found dead in his bed | The Mercury
thread.title_full: Brother of Toowoomba murder victim found dead in his bed | The Mercury

title: Brother of Toowoomba murder victim found dead in his bed | The Mercury
text:
Brother of Toowoomba murder victim found dead in his bed Charlotte Lam, The Chronicle, News Corp Australia Network February 20, 2017 12:15pm 
A TOOWOOMBA family have lost their second disabled son after the murder of their first five years ago. 
The Chronicle reports that Adam Lasker, the brother of murdered teenager Jake Lasker, was found dead in his bed yesterday morning. 
His father John found him. 
“He never sleeps in so when I walked into his room and saw him, I just knew,” he said. 
“I have no idea what I’m doing, my wheels are still spinning in mud if you know what I mean.” 
Adam, who was only 21, had autism. Mr Lasker said an autopsy had begun. 
The couple’s oldest son Jake, 19, who had Asperger’s syndrome, was stabbed to death in 2012 by Max Peter Smith, who was jailed for life in 2014. 
Kyle Mitchell Dumesny, who had plotted the killing with Smith, pleaded guilty to manslaughter last October and was jailed for seven years. media_camera Jake Lasker, 19, was stabbed to death in 2012. 
Mr Lasker said the couple yesterday had been surrounded by close friends. 
“It’s rocked our world to lose both sons in five years,” he said. 
“You don’t ever expect to have a funeral for your 19-year-old son and then to have another one for your 21-year-old son. 
“I’m so lost.” 
Family friend Damien Kampf raised money for Jake’s funeral costs five years ago through donation tins and the generosity of the Toowoomba community. 
He has now created a GoFundMe campaign to help the couple prepare to bury another child. 
“No parent should have to bury their child, let alone two,” he said. 
Police last night were unable to comment on the matter.
